criteria.details: Score: 1.00 - All facts and figures in the summary are accurate and traceable to the source document. Q3 revenue of $180,169M (page 4), Q3 operating income of $17,422M (page 4), Q3 diluted EPS of $1.95 (page 4), Q4 revenue guidance of $206.0-213.0B (page 32), Q4 operating income guidance of $21.0-26.0B (page 32) are all correctly stated. The $4.3B in special charges ($2.5B FTC settlement on page 7 + $1.8B severance on page 7), $9.5B Anthropic gains (pages 8, 11-12), AWS revenue of $33.0B with 20% YoY growth and $11.4B operating income (page 20), advertising growth of 24% to $17.7B (page 21), and all other figures are accurately extracted and properly contextualized.

Score: 1.00 - The summary comprehensively covers all key topics: (1) Segment Performance - detailed breakdown of AWS (re-acceleration to 20% growth, $33.0B revenue, $11.4B operating income, 35% margin, AI demand), North America ($106.3B sales, 11% growth, operating income impact from FTC settlement), and International ($40.9B sales, 14% growth, $1.2B operating income); (2) Revenue Growth - 13% YoY with FX impact noted; (3) Margin Trends - operating income flat YoY but adjusted figures provided excluding special charges; (4) Growth Drivers - advertising (24% growth), third-party seller services, subscriptions, AI initiatives (Rufus, Trainium2, Connect); (5) Forward Guidance - Q4 revenue and operating income ranges with assumptions; (6) Capital Deployment - CapEx of $34.2B, free cash flow decline; (7) Key Risks - antitrust litigation, ICA fine, macroeconomic uncertainty. All material topics are addressed.

Score: 0.95 - The summary provides substantial insights beyond restating numbers: (1) YoY comparisons throughout (e.g., operating income flat YoY but contextualizes with special charges exclusion showing underlying growth to $21.7B); (2) Trend analysis of AWS re-acceleration from prior quarters; (3) Strategic implications of AI investments (Rufus 60% higher conversion, Trainium2 150% QoQ growth, Connect $1B run rate); (4) Contextualization of financial impacts (e.g., diluted EPS up 36% benefiting from Anthropic gains); (5) Forward-looking implications of CapEx increases in 2025-2026; (6) Risk assessment of ongoing litigation. Minor deduction as some insights could be slightly deeper (e.g., analyzing margin compression trends or competitive positioning implications), but overall demonstrates strong analytical perspective suitable for investment banking work.

Score: 1.00 - The summary is exceptionally well-organized with clear sections: Overview, Segment Performance, Growth Drivers, Capital Deployment, Key Risks, and Q4 Guidance. Word count is approximately 450 words, within the 300-500 word target range. Language is professional and appropriate for senior bankers, using industry terminology correctly (YoY, FX-adjusted, operating margin, annualized revenue run rate, CapEx, FCF TTM). The structure follows a logical flow from topline results to segment detail to drivers to forward outlook. Information density is high without being cluttered, and key metrics are properly highlighted and contextualized.
